title: Banking & Finance: Ex-Analyst Is Barred For Insider Trading
text:
In April, Mr. Maguire bought 2,000 shares of one company for around $128,000. In June, he bought 29,000 shares of another company for nearly $722,000.

The stock upgrades had been approved internally at the time Mr. Maguire bought his shares but he did so ahead of publication of the upgrades, Finra said.

The regulator didn't disclose the companies in question.

Finra, Wall Street's regulatory organization, also said that Mr. Maguire traded securities of issuers that he covered and sold issuers' securities when he rated them as a "buy" in his research.

He also wrote research reports and didn't disclose that a household member had a financial interest in the issuers' securities, which is against Finra regulations, the regulator said.

Mr. Maguire also lied to the regulator regarding his trading during testimony, Finra said.

Goldman fired Mr. Maguire in November. He had started working at the company in 2010.

In settling the matter, Mr. Maguire didn't admit or deny the charges, the regulator said. He did allow Finra to enter its findings, it said.

A representative for Mr. Maguire didn't immediately respond to a request for comment.

"The former employee in question violated a firm policy and we terminated his employment," Goldman said in an emailed statement. "We have a zero-tolerance policy for behavior of this sort and have cooperated with the proper authorities."
